  • RLIMS-P (indra.sources.rlimsp)
  • View page source

RLIMS-P (indra.sources.rlimsp)Â¶

RLIMS-P is a rule-based reading system which extracts phosphorylation relationships with sites from text. RLIMS-P exposes a web service to submit PubMed IDs and PMC IDs for processing.

See also: https://research.bioinformatics.udel.edu/rlimsp/ and https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4568560/

RLIMS-P API (indra.sources.rlimsp.api)Â¶

indra.sources.rlimsp.api.process_from_webservice(id_val, id_type='pmcid', source='pmc', with_grounding=True)[source]Â¶

Return an output from RLIMS-p for the given PubMed ID or PMC ID.

Parameters:
  • id_val (str) â A PMCID, with the prefix PMC, or pmid, with no prefix, of the paper to be âreadâ.
  • id_type (str) â Either âpmidâ or âpmcidâ. The default is âpmcidâ.
  • source (str) â Either âpmcâ or âmedlineâ, whether you want pmc fulltext or medline abstracts.
  • with_grounding (bool) â The RLIMS-P web service provides two endpoints, one pre-grounded, the other not so much. The grounded endpoint returns far less content, and may perform some grounding that can be handled by the grounding mapper.
Returns:

An RlimspProcessor which contains a list of extracted INDRA Statements in its statements attribute.
Return type:

indra.sources.rlimsp.processor.RlimspProcessor
